movies.title: Sudden Death!
movies.plot: Los Angeles has been overtaken by a virus known as Sudden Death Syndrome, a disease that causes its victim to die suddenly and has only one symptom... spontaneously breaking into well-choreographed song and dance.
movies.simplePlot: Los Angeles has been overtaken by a virus known as Sudden Death Syndrome, a disease that causes its victim to die suddenly and has only one symptom... spontaneously breaking into well-choreographed song and dance.

biography.bio: Matt Lutz was born on October 15, 1978 in Anderson, Indiana, USA as Matthew Christopher Lutz. He is an actor, known for A Walk to Remember (2002), Sudden Death! (2010) and Bringing Down the House (2003). He was previously married to Christy Hall.
biography.name: Matt Lutz

biography.bio: Autumn Hurlbert is an actress, known for Sudden Death! (2010), The Sound of Music Live! (2013) and Research. (2012).
biography.name: Autumn Hurlbert

biography.bio: The youngest of four brothers, Doug Jones was born on May 24, 1960 in Indianapolis, Indiana, and grew up in the city's Northeastside. After attending Bishop Chatard High School, he headed off to Ball State University, where he graduated in 1982 with a Bachelor's degree in Telecommunications, with a minor in Theatre. He learned mime at school, joining a troupe and doing the whole white-face thing, and has also worked as a contortionist. After a hitch in theater in Indiana, he moved to Los Angeles in 1985, and has not been out of work since - he's acted in over 25 films, many television series (Including the award-winning Buffy the Vampire Slayer (1997), his episode 'Hush' garnered two Emmy nominations) and over 90 commercials and music videos with the likes of Madonna and Marilyn Manson. Although known mostly for his work under prosthetics, he has also performed as 'himself' in such highly-rated films as Adaptation. (2002) with Nicolas Cage and indie projects such as Phil Donlon's A Series of Small Things (2005). But it is his sensitive and elegant performance as 'Abe Sapien' in Hellboy (2004), which stormed to the top of the U.S. box office in the spring of 2004, that has brought him an even higher profile and much praise from audiences and critics alike. Doug is married and lives in California.
biography.name: Doug Jones

biography.bio: John Larroquette was born on November 25, 1947 in New Orleans, Louisiana, USA as John Bernard Larroquette. He is an actor, known for Night Court (1984), The John Larroquette Show (1993) and Ri¢hie Ri¢h (1994). He has been married to Elizabeth Larroquette since July 4, 1975. They have three children. He was previously married to Bertie Good.
biography.name: John Larroquette

biography.bio: Mark Christopher Lawrence was born on May 22, 1964 in Los Angeles, California, USA. He is an actor and writer, known for Chuck (2007), Terminator 2: Judgment Day (1991) and The Pursuit of Happyness (2006).
biography.name: Mark Christopher Lawrence

biography.bio: Wes Hall is an actor and producer, known for Sudden Death! (2010).
biography.name: Wes Hall

biography.bio: Kahle McCann is a writer and actor, known for I Hate It! (2013), Inside the Extras Studio (2015) and Research. (2012).
biography.name: Kahle McCann

biography.bio: Beth Castle is known for her work on Sudden Death! (2010), Not That Funny (2012) and Praying the Hours.
biography.name: Beth Castle

biography.bio: Mylinda Royer was born as Mylinda Faith Wenz. She is an actress, known for The Devil's Candy (2015), Lost in the Sun (2016) and General Hospital (1963). She has been married to Ted Royer since October 6, 2001.
biography.name: Mylinda Royer

biography.bio: Daniel J. Roberts is known for his work on Sleepy Hollow (2013), Missing in the Mansion (2012) and Sudden Death! (2010).
biography.name: Daniel J. Roberts

biography.bio: Iván Kamarás was born on December 22, 1972 in Pécs, Hungary. He is an actor and cinematographer, known for Hellboy II: The Golden Army (2008), Spy (2015) and A Good Day to Die Hard (2013).
biography.name: Iván Kamarás

biography.bio: Melissa Disney was born on November 20, 1970 in San Diego County, California, USA as Melissa L. Smith. She is an actress, known for As Told by Ginger (2000), In a World... (2013) and Jakers! The Adventures of Piggley Winks (2003). She has been married to Ryan Paul James since October 15, 2010.
biography.name: Melissa Disney

biography.bio: Born in San Francisco, Bonnie MacBird received her BA in Music and Masters in Film from Stanford in 1973. From 1975-79 she was a Development Executive in Feature Films at Universal Studios reporting to President Ned Tanen. During her four years at Uni she read thousands of scripts, and worked as a development executive on nearly all projects in development at that time including Heroes, Car Wash, Smokey and the Bandit, and many more. MacBird left Uni and worked for two years on TRON as the original writer, as well as producing early test shoots combining live action with animation. She continued to write for film, television and theater, with sales and productions in each of these media. Her production company, formed in 1986 with partner Jim Shasky, garnered three Emmys (two for feature segments in 1986 and '87, and one for the full length documentary "Squeakers" in 2004), as well as many national awards including 11 Cine Golden Eagles. Her original stage musical "Hot Roles" was a Los Angeles success, as was "The Getaway Cabaret", both of which she wrote and directed. She continues her stage work and most recently wrote eight one acts for The Noho Arts Center. MacBird is also a stage and screen actor, who studied Shakespeare at Oxford, and with the renowned Shakespeare and Company in Lenox Mass. Additional training included acting with Don Richardson and Darryl Hickman, improvisation with Second City and The Groundlings, and voice with Calvin Remsberg and Sue Fink. She teaches screenwriting at UCLA Extension,narrates audio books and is a novelist with a three book deal with HarperCollins for Sherlock Holmes mysteries. Art in the Blood was released in 2015 and is now in 14 languages.. Unquiet Spirits will be out Sept 2017, followed later by The Devil's Due.
biography.name: Bonnie MacBird

biography.bio: Eric Lombart is known for his work on Rough Day (2015), Marriage Is... (2016) and Where the Sun Don't Shine (2008).
biography.name: Eric Lombart

biography.bio: Selah Victor (say-la) was born in Bakersfield, California, one of eight children. She studied Theater at The University of California, Irvine and at The University of Birmingham, England. In addition to her film and television work, Selah has been seen in theaters around Los Angeles, including Garry Marshall's Falcon Theater, Second City, Actors Co-op, and Theater West.
biography.name: Selah Victor

filmingLocations.location: Raleigh Manhattan Beach Studios - 1600 Rosecrans Avenue, Manhattan Beach, California, USA
